channel.title: RuneScape Player [b]Jailed[/b]
channel.description:
I was on google and noticed this text on a court website.
A Dutch court in Leeuwarden has sentenced a 16-year-old boy to do either 160 hours community service or 80 days jail time after stealing virtual property. The ruling comes after the defendant was charged with beating a 13-year-old boy and forcing him to hand over money and virtual property from a character on his Runescape account. The defendant was accused of wielding a knife with intent, but the civil case dealt not with the threat to the boy’s life but with the theft of the virtual amulet and mask. It’s the first time a Dutch judge has treated theft of virtual property as an illegal act, stating that “Goods don’t have to be material for the law to consider them stolen.”

item.title: RuneScape Player [b]Jailed[/b]
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Powerslave, post:1, topic:280843”][quote author=Slivion link=topic=370728.msg2801477#msg2801477 date=1243460568]
I was on google and noticed this text on a court website.

A Dutch court in Leeuwarden has sentenced a 16-year-old boy to do either 160 hours community service or 80 days jail time after stealing virtual property. The ruling comes after the defendant was charged with beating a 13-year-old boy and forcing him to hand over money and virtual property from a character on his Runescape account. The defendant was accused of wielding a knife with intent, but the civil case dealt not with the threat to the boy’s life but with the theft of the virtual amulet and mask. It’s the first time a Dutch judge has treated theft of virtual property as an illegal act, stating that “Goods don’t have to be material for the law to consider them stolen.”

[/quote]

I don’t know whats worse… the asinine Dutch legal system, or the fact that someone robbed someone else for RuneScape items.[/quote]
or the fact that someone actually gives a shit

Read full topic
